summary: The document is a declassified or partially redacted report associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details a congress or meeting (WPC) concluding on 16 May, highlighting U.S. participants such as Sidney Peck, who addressed the Vietnam War. The WPC posthumously awarded the Joliot Curie Gold Medal to Rev. Martin Luther King, with the award accepted by Rev. Ralph Abernathy and Rev. W. Walker, recognized as an American peace fighter. Additionally, it notes the involvement of U.S. delegates in meetings with Indochinese counterparts and the re-election of Herbert A. P. Theker and Carlton Goodlett to the presidential board. The document is classified as 'SECRET' and references Budapest and headquarters communications.
key_findings: Details a congress or meeting (WPC) involving U.S. participants.
Sidney Peck's remarks on the Vietnam War are highlighted.
Documents the posthumous awarding of the Joliot Curie Gold Medal to Rev. Martin Luther King.
Mentions U.S. delegates' engagements with Indochinese delegates.
Reports the re-election of Herbert A. P. Theker and Carlton Goodlett to the presidential board.
